title: How to Make a Gluten Free Pancake Pie

steps.headline: Prepare your batter and fillings.
steps.description: This method works best with batter that has about the same thickness as tomato sauce––if your batter is too thick or thin, add a little extra water or gluten free flour respectively.

steps.headline: Grease and preheat your pie iron/taiyaki pan.
With the heat off, half fill your pan with pancake batter.
steps.description: Residual heat from the pan should cook the batter a little creating a barrier to keep your filling from sinking through later.

steps.headline: Place a few spoonfuls of filling in the middle of the batter.
Cover your filling with more pancake batter.
Close the pan, flip it over and put it on the heat.
Cook on medium heat, turning occasionally, for about five minutes or until it is golden brown on both sides.
Serve immediately or allow to cool and freeze to eat another day.

text: Prepare your batter and fillings. This method works best with batter that has about the same thickness as tomato sauce––if your batter is too thick or thin, add a little extra water or gluten free flour respectively. Grease and preheat your pie iron/taiyaki pan.  With the heat off, half fill your pan with pancake batter. Residual heat from the pan should cook the batter a little creating a barrier to keep your filling from sinking through later. Place a few spoonfuls of filling in the middle of the batter.  Cover your filling with more pancake batter.  Close the pan, flip it over and put it on the heat.  Cook on medium heat, turning occasionally, for about five minutes or until it is golden brown on both sides.  Serve immediately or allow to cool and freeze to eat another day.
